Class MinesweeperGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • MinesweeperGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MinesweeperGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Author:
    Jethro Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinesweeperGUI

        public MinesweeperGUI(int width,
              int height,
              int creepers)
        Parameterized constructor. Takes in three parameters.
        Parameters:
        width - int that defines the width.
        height - int that defines the height.
        creepers - int that defines the number of creepers to generate.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • assignMines

        private void assignMines(int[] creeperField)
        Takes the creeperField array of creeper positions and assigns the creepers to the 2D MyButton grid.
        Parameters:
        creeperField - int array that holds the positions of all the creepers.

      • buildGrid

        private void buildGrid()
        Builds the grid used for playing.

      • createJFrame

        private void createJFrame()
        Initializes the main JFrame and changes all necessary settings.

      • generateCreepers

        private void generateCreepers(int clicked)
        Generates mines randomly, while avoiding the first clicked MyButtons position.
        Parameters:
        clicked - int of the position of the first click. The generation process avoids using this MyButton to hold a creeper.

      • handleQuit

        private void handleQuit()
        Handles the quit request by the user. For when the user clicks the quit button.

      • handleTime

        private int[] handleTime(long timeToHandle)
        Takes in the current time and returns an int array that has hours as its first element, minutes as its second and seconds as its third.
        Parameters:
        timeToHandle - long with the current time.
        Returns:
        int [] of length 3 that has hours as its first element, minutes as its second and seconds as its third.

      • help

        private void help()
        Generates the help box.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent me)
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

        Specified by:

        public void mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent arg0)
        Specified by:
        mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent mep)
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent mer)
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • reset

        private void reset(int choice)
        Resets the board. Regenerating all the mine positions, reseting the timer and flag count.
        Parameters:
        choice - int that specifies which reset action the user wishes to perform. 0 is for when the user loses. 1 is for a win. 3 is for a manual reset.

      • selectDifficulty

        private void selectDifficulty()
        Shows the dialog that allows the user to select the difficulty.

      • setJFrameSize

        private void setJFrameSize()
        Sets the size of the JFrame and various container Frames based on the number of mines.

      • setSignsIcons

        private void setSignsIcons()
        Updates the counter that indicates the number of signs left.

      • showBombs

        private void showBombs()
        Makes all the bombs visible after the user clicks on a bomb. Loops through all the buttons and sets the icons of buttons that have a creeper.

      • startTiming

        private void startTiming()
        Starts the timer process. It creates a scheduled task that runs every second. It updates the recorded time and the time displayed and then creates a new timed event.

      • uncover

        private void uncover(java.lang.String xPosition,
           java.lang.String yPosition,
           int choice)
        Uncovers all tiles not adjacent to a tile with a bomb.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - int containing the x position of the button clicked.
        yPosition - int containing the x position of the button clicked.
        choice - int which represents which function the uncover will perform. 0 is the default option. 1 is the option for when the user clicks with both mouse buttons.

      • updateTime

        private void updateTime(int[] time)
        Updates the time being displayed.
        Parameters:
        time - int [] of length 3 that has hours as its first element, minutes as its second and seconds as its third.
